sorcer.core.context.eval

Class ContextGroovyObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.core.context.eval.ContextGroovyObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ContextGroovyObject
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class is used to represent a Groovy Object stored in a context. A special class was created because compilation issues can occur if the Groovy libraries are not linked properly. This class also includes methods to evaluate the Groovy expression. More information can be found at: http://groovy.codehaus.org/ Providers that utilize the getValue methods of this object must add: ${path.separator}${sorcer.home}/common/groovy.jar to the sorcer-jars section of their run.xml See groovy.doc under the notes section for more information.
    Author:
    Greg McChesney
    See Also:

      • ContextGroovyObject

        public ContextGroovyObject(String expression)
        Constructor for ContextGroovyObject used to create it with an expression
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public Object getValue()
                throws Exception
        This returns the evaluated value of the Groovy expression specified in the constructor. In the event the expression was not valid an error message is displayed and the method returns null.
        Returns:
        Object evaluated from expression
        Throws:
        Exception
        Exception - if there is a problem

      • getValue

        public Object getValue(HashMap<String,Object> attributes)
                throws Exception
        This returns the evaluated value of the Groovy expression specified in the constructor. This version allows the user to register In the event the expression was not valid an error message is displayed and the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        attributes - HashMap of items to register with the Groovy interpreter. The key is the name of the variable in Groovy and the Object is its value.
        Returns:
        Object evaluated from expression, null if expression is empty.
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is a problem
